meanings.definition: The function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: In the school play, my role was to be the tree in the background.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's role is to guide and educate the students.
meanings.sent3: During the game of charades, my role as a mime was quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: As the captain of the team, his role was like that of a leader on a battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The role of a firefighter is to bravely save lives in dangerous situations.

meanings.definition: A character or part played by an actor.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her role in the play every day to perfect her performance.
meanings.sent2: The actor's role in the movie required a lot of emotional depth.
meanings.sent3: His role as a villain in the play made the audience boo and hiss.
meanings.sent4: The role of Romeo in the Shakespearean play is iconic for many actors.
meanings.sent5: Playing the role of a detective on TV, she solved mysteries with ease.

meanings.definition: A prescribed or expected behavior in a social situation.
meanings.sent1: In a job interview, it is important to understand the role of professionalism.
meanings.sent2: Respecting others' opinions is a crucial role in maintaining harmony in a group.
meanings.sent3: His role as the jokester at the party always lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The role of a good host is to ensure guests feel welcomed and comfortable.
meanings.sent5: Kindness plays a significant role in building strong relationships with others.
